page.title: 08Gt.Coxwell's Agriculture.
page.content: The agricultural land belongs mainly to 8 farms,the largest proportion be- ing National Trust tenancies.There is only one dairy herd,the other farms having beef cattle & one herd of pigs. (Twenty years ago there were at least three lots of milking cows). Less milking cows have led to reduced pasture and more arable land.This is a result of Common Market Policies,e.g. the milk quota etc. The first cut of grass is mainly used for silage and the second for hay, weather permitting. The arable crops are wheat,barley,a little maize and some potatoes. There is a plantation of larch and other conifers on land owned by the National Trust,and partly managed by the Forestry Commission.
